title.narrative: Introduction of indoor crop cultivation in Myanmar

description.narrative:
MUF Coop thus needs a well-trained pool of experienced lead farmers and extension staff, ready to take on board and induce systematically new lead-farmers (especially women) to reach out in a pyramid system to at least 10% of the members in Heho region in one year and realise with them the required increase in production and food quality. And we need to be able to organize this service within the cooperative in a sustainable manner.
The aim is to create a more sustainable form of horticultural crop production through technical training to ensure year-round production in protected structures, optimize the use of fertilizers, water and plant protection chemicals. Finally, to ensure the production of healthy and safe products for the consumers. Therefore, this training program will contribute to enhancing food and nutrition security as efficient extension is expected to contribute to overcome inefficient production and to reduce its reliance on natural resources.

MUF Coop was originally set up in 2010 representing a farmer group named Heho Fruit Flowers and Vegetables Producers Cluster which has 800 producer’s farmers. Due to restructuring, it was formed as a cooperative in 2019 but it is still representing the Heho Fruit Flowers and Vegetables Producers Cluster.
As a well-established organization, it listens to its members’ needs and also has eagerness to learn and improve operations. For MUF Coop’s growth and realization of its ambitious long-term plan to bring their members to a higher level innovation and modern growing techniques are key.
MUF Coop has the scale to facilitate training to its members to create a more sustainable form of horticultural crop production. Through technical training MUF Coop aims to ensure year-round production in protected structures, optimize the use of fertilizers, water and plant protection chemicals. So on, productivity has a chance to increase and the food quality will improve to ensure healthy and safe products to the consumers. MUF Coop’s ambition is to train on indoor crop cultivation, making Heho’s agricultural activities more sustainable, increase productivity and making its members less dependent on changing climatological conditions. Its potential outreach, through the 10 villages, is promising.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Number of farmers applying good agricultural practices

description.narrative: Number of farmers that apply Good Agricultural Practices (GAP). GAP activities encompass different components of agricultural practice: dealing with agricultural inputs, handling fertilizers and pesticides use, harvesting practices and personal and product safety and hygiene (when applicable according to EU import regulations)
Number of people who have benefitted (directly or indirectly) through a Cordaid Sustainable Livelihoods Intervention

title.narrative: % of feedback and valid complaints received that are responded to/resolved

description.narrative: Percent of feedback and valid complaints received at project or country/field office level, via Cordaid, a partner or consortium member that are respond to and/or resolved (in accordance with Cordaid FCM minimum standards). This excludes invalid and sensitive complaints.

title.narrative: The project integrates climate risks in programming

description.narrative: The integration of climate risks in programming includes an undertaking of concrete actions to reduce and/or mitigate risks related to climate change impact and disaster risks ( for example droughts, erosion, salinization, flooding, etc.) The projects we refer to could be on the themes of health education, justice, security, disaster management, finance and livelihoods.
